reviews.text:
Small bar to enjoy flaminco dance and live music.
They run a 30’ show.
Quite interesting.
They do not allow recording during the live.
The singer was amazing and the dancer very passionate.

A bit difficult to watch flamenco if you fail to get a table because everyone will stand and short people like me will never get the chance. But there is a circulation of shows every 30 minutes and the performers will go outside to ask for a tip at the end. You can also have a photo taken.

Ordering food only has I think a 20 minute window so I suggest eating out and just grab your jerez or cerveza here while watching a show.

It’s not allowed to take videos as well.

Do you need a quick drink, a bag of Chips and nice evening with Flamenco show? This place is for you! It works like this: you order a drink and only then you can take a sit freely to one of the table; then you can take from the kitchen area one of they simple tapas. Suggested for an aperitivo with Friends!

The flamenco show is simply amazing! It happens at 8:30, 9:30, and 10:30 PM. You just need to buy a drink (per person) and leave some tips :) they say cash only but have a credit card machine if you really need it, which I preferred. I attended flamenco theatre but found this show to be so spellbinding as well. The dancer is full of passion and you can see it in her moves and expressions. Highly recommend! Phone should be put away during the performance.

The show was great!!! A big minus was that they are not taking card payments, is ONLY CASH.
But great atmosphere, good drinks. Food... I would not recommend but in rest amazing. Is looking like an old taverna but I think doesn't matter when the atmosphere is so great! We went 2 nights in the row!! Please add card payment, first night we left in the middle of show because we didn't had cash to spend anymore....
